metadata.dc:author: Ciudad, M J
Crespo, E
Llanos, D
Arrazola, J
metadata.dc:description: Obstruction of the nasal airway is potentially lethal in newborns because they are forced to breathe through their noses. The most common cause of obstruction is atresia of the choanae; however, other entities such as congenital nasal pyriform aperture stenosis, although rare, must be considered in the differential diagnosis of a newborn that shows signs and symptoms of upper airway compromise. We report two cases of nasal pyriform aperture stenosis seen at our center; we describe the main characteristics of the condition and review the relevant literature.

[Congenital nasal pyriform aperture stenosis].
